_header: That worthy David which that slew Goliath
_description: John Lydgate, a Mumming for the Goldsmiths of London — fourteen stanzas rhyme royal

CamTCC600.First Lines:
Þat worþy dauid which þat sloughe GolyeÞe first
                    kyng þat sprang oute of JesseOf god echeson þe bookes
                    specefyeBy Samuel sette in his royal see…
CamTCC600.Last Lines:
…Sette þees and rest welfare and vnyteeDuryng youre tyme
                    thoroughe oute þis cytee
CamTCC600.Note: With Latin and English marginal glosses.
CamTCC600.Attributed Title:
And nowe filoweþe a letre made in wyse of balade by ledegate daun
                    Johan of a mommynge whiche þe Golde smythes of þe Cite of London
                    mommed in Right fresshe and costelewelych desguysing to þeyre Mayre
                    Eestfeld vpon Candelmasse day at nyght affter souper brought and presented vn to
                    þe Mayre by an heraude cleped ffortune (p. 175); A desgysing to þe
                    Mayre By þe Goldsmythes (RT)
CamTCC600.Editions:
Brotanek,  Rudolph. 
             Die Englischen Maskenspiele.
         Vienna, Leipzig: W. Braumüller, 1902: 323-5.
MacCracken,  Henry Noble,
                        ed.  
             John Lydgate: The Minor Poems, Vol. II: Secular Poems.
EETS
         o.s. 192 (1934); repr. 1961: 1.698-701.

BLAdd29729.First Lines:
That worthy david whiche that sloughe goliethe fyrst kyng that
                    sprang oute of Jesse…
BLAdd29729.Last Lines:
…sett pees and reste welfare and vnytiedurynge yowre tyme
                    thoroughe this sytie
BLAdd29729.Attributed Title:
her folowythe a lettar made by Iohn lydgat for a mommynge whiche þe
                    goldsmythes of london shewyd before Eestfyld þe mayr on candylmas day at
                    nyght this letar was presentyd by an harold callyd fortune (f. 134, by scribe,
                    John Stow).
